Make Transcript-to-Gene Mappings

Source: R/makeTx2Gene.R
makeTx2Gene.Rd

Make Transcript-to-Gene Mappings

makeTx2GeneFromEnsembl(organism, genomeBuild = NULL, release = NULL)

makeTx2GeneFromEnsDb(object)

makeTx2GeneFromGFF(file)

Arguments

organism

string. Full Latin organism name (e.g. "Homo sapiens").
genomeBuild

string or NULL. Ensembl genome build assembly name (e.g. "GRCh38"). If set NULL, defaults to the most recent build available. Note: don't pass in UCSC build IDs (e.g. "hg38").
release

scalar integer or NULL. Ensembl release version (e.g. 90). If set NULL, defaults to the most recent release available.
object

Object.
file

string. File path.

Value

Tx2Gene.

GFF/GTF file

Remote URLs and compressed files are supported.

See also

makeGRanges.

Examples

## makeTx2GeneFromEnsembl ====
x <- makeTx2GeneFromEnsembl(organism = "Homo sapiens")
#> Making GRanges from Ensembl.
#> Matching EnsDb from AnnotationHub 2.13.8 (2018-10-18).
#> AH64923: Ensembl 94 EnsDb for Homo sapiens
#> Making GRanges from EnsDb object.
#>   - Organism: Homo sapiens
#>   - Genome Build: GRCh38
#>   - Ensembl Release: 94
#>   - Level: transcripts
#> Defining broadClass using: geneName, transcriptBiotype, seqnames
#> Arranging by transcriptID.
print(x)
#> Tx2Gene 0.99.0
#> https://steinbaugh.com/basejump
#> citation("basejump")
#> DataFrame with 228432 rows and 2 columns
#>           transcriptID          geneID
#>            <character>     <character>
#> 1      ENST00000000233 ENSG00000004059
#> 2      ENST00000000412 ENSG00000003056
#> 3      ENST00000000442 ENSG00000173153
#> 4      ENST00000001008 ENSG00000004478
#> 5      ENST00000001146 ENSG00000003137
#> ...                ...             ...
#> 228428       LRG_998t1         LRG_998
#> 228429       LRG_998t2         LRG_998
#> 228430       LRG_999t1         LRG_999
#> 228431       LRG_999t2         LRG_999
#> 228432        LRG_99t1          LRG_99
#> 228432 transcripts; 65687 genes

## makeTx2GeneFromEnsDb ====
x <- makeTx2GeneFromEnsDb("EnsDb.Hsapiens.v75")
#> Making GRanges from EnsDb object.
#>   - Organism: Homo sapiens
#>   - Genome Build: GRCh37
#>   - Ensembl Release: 75
#>   - Level: transcripts
#> Defining broadClass using: geneName, transcriptBiotype, seqnames
#> Arranging by transcriptID.
print(x)
#> Tx2Gene 0.99.0
#> https://steinbaugh.com/basejump
#> citation("basejump")
#> DataFrame with 215647 rows and 2 columns
#>           transcriptID          geneID
#>            <character>     <character>
#> 1      ENST00000000233 ENSG00000004059
#> 2      ENST00000000412 ENSG00000003056
#> 3      ENST00000000442 ENSG00000173153
#> 4      ENST00000001008 ENSG00000004478
#> 5      ENST00000001146 ENSG00000003137
#> ...                ...             ...
#> 215643        LRG_94t1          LRG_94
#> 215644        LRG_96t1          LRG_96
#> 215645        LRG_97t1          LRG_97
#> 215646        LRG_98t1          LRG_98
#> 215647        LRG_99t1          LRG_99
#> 215647 transcripts; 64102 genes

## makeTx2GeneFromGFF ====
## GTF
file <- file.path(basejumpCacheURL, "example.gtf")
x <- makeTx2GeneFromGFF(file)
#> Making Tx2Gene from GFF.
#> Reading example.gtf.
#> Ensembl GTF detected.
print(x)
#> Tx2Gene 0.99.0
#> https://steinbaugh.com/basejump
#> citation("basejump")
#> DataFrame with 20 rows and 2 columns
#>           transcriptID             geneID
#>            <character>        <character>
#> 1   ENSMUST00000193812 ENSMUSG00000102693
#> 2   ENSMUST00000082908 ENSMUSG00000064842
#> 3   ENSMUST00000162897 ENSMUSG00000051951
#> 4   ENSMUST00000159265 ENSMUSG00000051951
#> 5   ENSMUST00000070533 ENSMUSG00000051951
#> ...                ...                ...
#> 16  ENSMUST00000194454 ENSMUSG00000102592
#> 17  ENSMUST00000157708 ENSMUSG00000088333
#> 18  ENSMUST00000194643 ENSMUSG00000102343
#> 19  ENSMUST00000192427 ENSMUSG00000102343
#> 20  ENSMUST00000208660 ENSMUSG00000025900
#> 20 transcripts; 17 genes

## GFF3
file <- file.path(basejumpCacheURL, "example.gff3")
x <- makeTx2GeneFromGFF(file)
#> Making Tx2Gene from GFF.
#> Reading example.gff3.
#> Ensembl GFF detected.
print(x)
#> Tx2Gene 0.99.0
#> https://steinbaugh.com/basejump
#> citation("basejump")
#> DataFrame with 26 rows and 2 columns
#>           transcriptID             geneID
#>            <character>        <character>
#> 1   ENSMUST00000193812 ENSMUSG00000102693
#> 2   ENSMUST00000082908 ENSMUSG00000064842
#> 3   ENSMUST00000162897 ENSMUSG00000051951
#> 4   ENSMUST00000159265 ENSMUSG00000051951
#> 5   ENSMUST00000070533 ENSMUSG00000051951
#> ...                ...                ...
#> 22  ENSMUST00000194992 ENSMUSG00000025900
#> 23  ENSMUST00000027032 ENSMUSG00000025900
#> 24  ENSMUST00000195384 ENSMUSG00000102948
#> 25  ENSMUST00000194382 ENSMUSG00000104123
#> 26  ENSMUST00000027035 ENSMUSG00000025902
#> 26 transcripts; 20 genes
